I'm gonna tell you some things about me, then am gonna ask you a question. So, please bare with me, and I hope you don't mind reading all of it:

I am a Palestinian. I live in Palestine. I have never committed violence against anyone, Israeli or non-Israeli, nor do I know anyone who has. Yet, and despite me being a very smart guy with a lot of potential, a humanitarian, and a pacifist, I've had to live all of my life confined within a city that is getting more crowded every day with no way of expanding or developing because we, as Palestinians, were deprived of all of our natural sources, including ALL bodies of water (rivers, lakes, and the sea), we're not allowed to have an airport, we're not allowed to develop our own technology, and most importantly (and the one that truly hurts my heart the most); we have absolutely no freedom of movement. I've always wanted to go camping, for example. However, going camping would basically be a suicide for me because, even in areas controlled by the Palestinian Authority, if I go to the mountains that are less than a Kilometer away from my city, I would be risking getting shot by the Israelis and the settlers who have occupied ILLEGALLY every mountain top in the West Bank (this is the area that was agreed upon to be under the control of the Palestinian Authority). And even if I just want to go visit my friends in nearby Palestinian cities, I would have to go through multiple military checkpoints, with guns aimed at my face throughout the way, and with the risk of being stripped and searched, and possibly not even being allowed to pass through and told to go back to my city.

I'm gonna tell you some things about me, then am gonna ask you a question. So, please bare with me, and I hope you don't mind reading all of it:

I am a Palestinian. I live in Palestine. I have never committed violence against anyone, Israeli or non-Israeli, nor do I know anyone who has. Yet, and despite me being a very smart guy with a lot of potential, a humanitarian, and a pacifist, I've had to live all of my life confined within a city that is getting more crowded every day with no way of expanding or developing because we, as Palestinians, were deprived of all of our natural sources, including ALL bodies of water (rivers, lakes, and the sea), we're not allowed to have an airport, we're not allowed to develop our own technology, and most importantly (and the one that truly hurts my heart the most); we have absolutely no freedom of movement. I've always wanted to go camping, for example. However, going camping would basically be a suicide for me because, even in areas controlled by the Palestinian Authority, if I go to the mountains that are less than a Kilometer away from my city, I would be risking getting shot by the Israelis and the settlers who have occupied ILLEGALLY every mountain top in the West Bank (this is the area that was agreed upon to be under the control of the Palestinian Authority). And even if I just want to go visit my friends in nearby Palestinian cities, I would have to go through multiple military checkpoints, with guns aimed at my face throughout the way, and with the risk of being stripped and searched, and possibly not even being allowed to pass through and told to go back to my city.

So, my question is, am I anti-semite for seeing the Israeli Government's policies regarding my ordeals (as well as every other Palestinian) as being wrong, inhumane, humiliating, and cruel? And if my view is justified, how come you very easily label anyone in the US as anti-semite for seeing this reality that we live in and pointing it out? How is that considered anti-semtie? And if it is, what exactly does anti-semite mean in this context?

Thank you :)
